result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2035; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. Fine set at ZERO.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Consecutive to: consecutive to Counts 2, 3, 4, 5 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not work in a place where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $100.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
No contact with any known illegal drug user, except during AODA treatment.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.

No drivers license suspension imposed.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served.
Consecutive to: consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 4, 5 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served.
Concurrent with: concurrent with Count 5 in 14CF1137 and consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served.
Concurrent with: concurrent with Count 4 in 14CF1137 and consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
Per Order Dated October 28, 2022, Appeal No 2019AP1313-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied.

Per Order dated September 13, 2022, Appeal No 2019AP1313-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order of the circuit court are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Paul G. Bonneson is relieved of any further representation of Robinson in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 2, 3, 4, 5 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program

AS TO COUNT 3-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 4, 5 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program

AS TO COUNT 4-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 16 YEARS, concurrent with Count 5 in 14CF1137 and consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 11 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program

AS TO COUNT 5-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 16 YEARS, concurrent with Count 4 in 14CF1137 and consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3 in 14CF1137 and any other sentences, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 11 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program

AS TO EACH COUNT:
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2035; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $100.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not work in a place where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.  
- Maintain fulltime employment.
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user, except during AODA treatment.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- No drivers license suspension imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Received and filed. tk
Motion for Judgment Not Withstanding the Verdict received and filed.
Exhibit List, Filed

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
At the hour of 12:55pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of GUILTY to Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 as charged in the information which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction entered in Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.

Court ordered the defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court informed the parties that any statements for sentencing must be made in writing and submitted to the Court at least 3 business days prior to the sentencing hearing. Court ordered that the order not allowing the defendant's mother, Valerie G. to be in room 313 of the Safety Building or on the third floor of the Safety Building is no longer in effect.

Exhibit list received and filed. Verdict forms received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial resumed. Jury in box at the hour of 9:28am. Sworn for defense: Defendant Harry Robinson. Exhibit 1 (several videos) and exhibit 57 published to the jury. Defense rests. State and defense rest. Testimony closed.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence without argument denied by the court. Jury back in box at 10:44am. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:46am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Jones and Campbell who were duly sworn for that purpose. Over defense objection, the Court will send back to the jury any exhibits were paper photos or reports.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial resumed. Jury back in box at the hour of 1:24pm. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Detectives Phillip Simmert and Keith Dodd. Jury out of box at 3:04pm for afternoon break. Jury back in the box at 3:34pm. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Keith Dodd. Jury out of the box 3:42pm. State rests subject to rebuttal. Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding the admissibility of certain evidence. Jury back in the box at 4:15pm.  Sworn for defense: Defendant Harry Robinson. Exhibit 57 published to the jury. Exhibits 39-56, and 57 (only portions specified on the record) received. Court instructed the jury. Jury excused for the evening at the hour of 4:31pm. Jury out of the box. Court ordered case adjourned until 06/18/2015 at 9:00am for continuation of jury trial in Branch 17. Case adjourned to Branch 17.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial resumed.  Jury in box at the hour of 10:00am. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Charles Libal, Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory Controlled Substance Analyst Birjees Kauser, Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory Controlled Substance Analyst Sandra Koresch, and City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Phillip Simmert. Exhibits 31-38 received. Court instructed the jury. Jury excused for the morning at the hour of 11:49am. Jury out of the box. Sidebars placed on the record. Court ordered case adjourned until 06/17/2015 at 1:15pm in Branch 17. Case adjourned to Branch 17.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial resumed. Jury in box at the hour of 1:26pm. Sworn for the state: Special Agent with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives Andrew Elmer. Jury out of box at 2:07pm. Discussion pertaining to the State's objection to defense counsel's question held on the record. For reasons stated on the record, Court went into a short recess. Court marked exhibits 500 and 501 for record making purposes. For reasons stated on the record, the Court ruled on the scope of questioning and testimony related to certain issues specified on the record. Jury back in box at 3:44pm. Sworn for the state: Special Agent with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives Andrew Elmer and City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Charles Libal. Photos and videos contained on exhibit 1 and exhibits 18-29 published to the jury. Exhibits 1 (only portions specified on the record), and 18-30 received. Court instructed the jury. Jury excused for the day at the hour of 4:42pm. Jury out of the box. Court ordered case adjourned until 06/17/2015 at 9:20am in Branch 17. Case adjourned to Branch 17.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial resumed. Issue with individual in gallery addressed on the record.  Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered the defendant's mother, Jackie G., be prohibited from being in the courtroom (room 313 of the Safety Building) or on the third floor of the Safety Building for the remainder of the jury trial. Jury in box at 10:33am. Sworn for the state: Special Agent with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives Andrew Elmer. Audio clips and photos from exhibit 1, and exhibits 7-17 published to the jury. Exhibits 7-17 received.  Court instructed the Jury. Jury excused for the morning at the hour of 12:01pm. Jury out of box. Court ordered case adjourned until 06/16/2015 at 1:15pm for continuation of jury trial in Branch 17.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Juror #7 in the box. Private voir dire of Juror 7. Juror #7 out of the box. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire resumed at the hour of  2:20. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Court instructed jury.  Opening statement made by state, defense counsel reserved the right the make an opening statement.  Jury out of box at 3:06pm. Jury in box at 3:36pm. Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the state:  Special Agent with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives Andrew Elmer
Audio clips and photos from exhibit 1, exhibits 2-6 published to the jury.
Exhibits 2-6 received. 
Court instructed the jury. Jury excused for the evening at the hour of 4:40pm. Jury out of the box. Court ordered case adjourned until 06/15/2015 at 9:00am in Branch 17.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered sequestration of witnesses.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:40am.  Court instructed the Jury. Jury panel excused for the morning at the hour of 11:50am. Jury panel out of box. Court ordered case adjourned until 1:45pm for continuation of jury trial in Branch 17.

Defendant Harry A Robinson in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Harry A Robinson in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case called for reason placed on the record, case remain in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled for 06-15-2015 at 9:00 am.
State contact court to schedule motion hearing. Parties notified. Case set for Motion Hearing on 06-12-2015 at 1:30 pm.
DEFENDANT'S MOTION RE: OBJECTION TO DEFECTIVE COURT PROCEEDING/OBJECTION TO EXTREME INEFFECTIVE ASSISTANCE COUNSEL.
